questions.question: Nasal bleeding can be stopped if the victim:

options.text: Is lying down with the head pushed back
Is standing and blocking the two nostrils for about 5-10 minutes
Is raising the right hand.

questions.question: Respiratory ways can be unblocked:

options.text: Only in medical units, using special instruments
At the scene of the accident through specific interventions
No matter where, if the victim supports this intervention.

questions.question: What first aid measures are taken in case of spinal injuries, if the victim's respiratory ways are free?

options.text: Move the victim to the rear seat
Try to turn the victim, if he is in an arched position
Do not move the victim from the position where you found him until the arrival of emergency mobile services, except if there is a danger of fire or asphyxiation, providing the only vital functions.

questions.question: Are you required to have a first aid kit, two warning triangles and a fire extinguisher, in the vehicle?

options.text: Only first aid medical kit
Only first aid medical kit and two triangles
All items listed must be available in the vehicle.

questions.question: In case of an accident where the victim has lost consciousness, the first measure will be:

options.text: To administer medicines from the first aid kit
To immobilize any fractures
To control breathing and heartbeat.

questions.question: What measures should a driver take on finding an overturned vehicle off the road, with injured people in it?

options.text: Stop, call the police, and, if necessary, carry the wounded to the nearest health facility
Has no obligation
Helps reposition the vehicle on its wheels.

questions.question: You are required to have in the vehicle:

options.text: Only a first aid medical kit
Only a first aid kit and warning triangles
A first aid medical kit, two triangles and an approved fire extinguisher

questions.question: In case of a fracture of the clavicle (shoulder is in a hanging position, slightly forward and down), proceed as follows:

options.text: Place the arm in a scarf
Bring the shoulder in a normal position
Leave the arm free.

questions.question: Disinfection of wounds that need to be bandaged is done with:

options.text: Hydrogen peroxide or iodine
Saline serum
Drinking water.

questions.question: How do you act in case of an injured whose heart has stopped beating?

options.text: Leave, because no one can do anything
Start artificial heart compression and artificial respiration
Move the injured vigorously, to make him recover.

questions.question: What should first intervention do, on the spot, to rescue a victim?

options.text: Wash the visible wounds
Release respiratory ways and ensure respiratory function
Clean and bandage the wounds.

questions.question: Depending on the condition of the injured, first aid measures will be administered in the following order:

options.text: Stop the bleeding, bandage wounds, immobilize fractures, artificial respiration, cardiac massage
Artificial respiration, CPR, stop the bleeding, bandage wounds, immobilize fractures
Immobilize fractures, bandage wounds, artificial respiration, CPR, stop the bleeding.

questions.question: You have injured a pedestrian who was crossing the street wrongly. What legal obligation do you have?

options.text: To immediately notify the police, do not modify or delete the traces of the accident and stay in place
Report to the nearest emergency police unit
Because the fault is not yours, you can continue driving if the accident is not serious.

questions.question: What do you do immediately after an accident with a wild animal?

options.text: Stop, switch on the hazard warning (blinking) lights and secure the accident scene
Notify animal protection societies
Take the animal home and notify the insurance company about damages to your vehicle.

questions.question: What should be used for immobilizing fractures of the upper limbs?

options.text: Makeshift splints
A simple scarf
In this case you do not intervene.

questions.question: In case of a massive bleeding injury, act as follows:

options.text: Place the person on the abdomen and give him plenty of fluids to drink
Place the person in a sitting position, on a chair, and talk to him
Place the person on his back with the legs elevated, immobilize possible fractures, do not give any fluids to drink and protect against cold.

questions.question: How do you recognize an open fracture at the limbs?

options.text: The fractured area is swollen
The skin is pierced in the fractured area
The victim cannot move.

questions.question: To immobilize a fracture the splint must be:

options.text: Rigid and long enough to cover the ends of the fracture
Soft
It does not matter.

questions.question: Respiratory arrest of injured persons can be caused by:

options.text: Multiple limb fractures
Intense blood loss
Respiratory way occlusion or blockage.

questions.question: When bandaging a wound one has to apply:

options.text: A sterile cotton compress
A sterile gauze compress
Any kind of compress.

questions.question: Immobilization of a fractured arm is made:

options.text: Right at the broken bone
Including the fractured bone and the top joint
Including the fractured bone and two joints, namely the upper and lower.

questions.question: What information must a note attached to a tourniquet contain, when applied to an injured person?

options.text: The marital status of the person
The position where the victim was found
Hour and minute of tourniquet application.

questions.question: How do you place an injured person, who shows spinal cord injury, in a transport vehicle?

options.text: In the sitting position
Horizontal, face up
The person must not be moved until the ambulance arrives.

questions.question: A hemorrhage at one of the limbs of an injured person will be stopped by:

options.text: Disinfecting the wound, bandaging and applying splints
Lifting the injured limb vertically
Compressive action on the damaged vessel or tourniquet application.

questions.question: When is it prohibited for motor vehicles to go on public roads?

options.text: When the registration plates are not compliant with standards
When the windshield shows cracks
When they have installed radar sensing devices.

questions.question: A victim who has lost a lot of blood must be placed:

options.text: Face up
Face down
Feet higher than the body.

questions.question: What should you do to avoid complications in case of a fracture?

options.text: Immobilize the fractured area
Sterilize and bandage the fractured zone
Apply a tourniquet above the fracture.

questions.question: Which is the most vulnerable category of traffic participants, comprising most of the victims?

options.text: Drivers of vehicles without driving experience
Drivers of vehicles with professional certification
Pedestrians, especially children and the elderly.

questions.question: What obligation does a driver have if he has injured a pedestrian who was crossing the road wrongly?

options.text: Transport the victim to the nearest health facility if transportation is not possible by other means, and return immediately to the scene of the accident
Remain at the scene until the police and ambulance arrive, with the full names and addresses of witnesses
Go to the nearest police station to report the accident.

questions.question: The severity of bleeding is estimated by:

options.text: The amount of blood lost
The color of blood lost
The viscosity of blood flow.

questions.question: Immobilization of fractures without splints is done with:

options.text: A plastic foil
Scarves and triangular cloth
Rigid cardboard.

questions.question: In case of an accident where victims cannot be released from a deformed vehicle:

options.text: Conscious victims are advised not to move and their release should be carried out quickly only by specialized teams
Release victims as soon as possible by any means
Administer painkillers to victims who are conscious.

questions.question: A function of the bandage is:

options.text: To stop the bleeding
To prevent soiling of clothes
To cover the unpleasant appearance of the wound.

questions.question: The left arm of the police officer horizontally stretched out means stop for:

options.text: Vehicles coming from the front
Vehicles coming from behind
Vehicles coming from the front and back.

questions.question: How does one act In case of a traffic accident where victims are immobilized inside a deformed vehicle whose doors are blocked?

options.text: Extract the victims quickly and firmly
Turn to specialized service units with extrication equipment for emergency situations
Ask others to help and quickly remove victims from the twisted structure.

questions.question: How do you remove injured persons from a vehicle?

options.text: By lifting
By pulling
By pushing.

questions.question: For immobilizing fractures using splints, it should be considered that:

options.text: The splint is not rigid
There are no required criteria for immobilizing fractures with splints
The splint should be sufficiently long.

questions.question: In case of ankle sprains, proceed as follows:

options.text: Forbid to the victim to stand on that ankle
Raise the affected leg and apply a tight bandage
Do not interfere and wait for the victim to be transported to a hospital.

questions.question: How does one administer first aid in case of wounds from cuts?

options.text: Cover the wound and stop the bleeding, then transport the injured to a doctor or hospital
Stop bleeding by stitching the wound
Transport the injured to the doctor, without doing anything else.

questions.question: How does one immobilize a fractured foot?

options.text: Suspend the leg in a rigid strap
With splints or a thick bandage from toes to knee
With a bandage from the ankle to the hip.

questions.question: The immobilization of a victim’s fractured leg is done by:

options.text: Tightly bandaging the fracture
By using splints
By using compression bandages.

questions.question: For bleeding wounds, in the initial phase you will:

options.text: Clean and bandage the wounds
Bandage the wounds
Stop the bleeding.

questions.question: If there are several people injured it is important to establish priorities?

options.text: Yes, first aid is given with priority to the most seriously injured persons
No, it doesn’t matter in which order first aid is given
Administer first aid to victims nearest to the savior.

questions.question: What obligations does a driver have on injuring a pedestrian who crossed the street in a forbidden place?

options.text: To present himself at the nearest police station
Because he is not guilty of the accident, he can leave the scene
To notify the police, and, in the absence of other means of transport, carry the victim to the nearest health facility, then return to the scene.

questions.question: What type of bleeding is the most dangerous?

options.text: One that causes slow and continuous bleeding
One that results in a rapid loss of blood
Any small visible bleeding.

questions.question: What does one do with a victim revived by cardio-respiratory resuscitation?

options.text: Transport him to his home or place of work
Always move him to a specialized medical unit
Wait for the traffic police to arrive.

questions.question: What should you consider before transporting a victim to the hospital?

options.text: Respiratory and circulatory function to be provided
The health facility where you are going should not be at a distance exceeding 50 km
The vehicle that will transport the victim should provide comfort.

questions.question: What measures are taken in case of a serious injury to a person in a car accident?

options.text: Immediately transport to the nearest health facility, with any means of transport available
Immediately transport to the nearest village and call an ambulance
Administer first aid until the ambulance arrives.

questions.question: When the mouth of the injured remains clenched, artificial respiration can be done:

options.text: Through the victim's shut mouth
Through the victim's nostrils
In this case artificial respiration is no longer required.

questions.question: In order to provide first aid in case of fractures, do the following procedure:

options.text: Push the bone fragments that have pierced the skin
Fix the fracture to prevent movement during immobilization of bone fragments. The splints need to be long enough to immobilize the joints above and below the fracture
The fracture is immobilized using sterile bandage

questions.question: What should be done to a victim who has a pulse but the breathing has stopped?

options.text: Carry out a cardio-respiratory resuscitation
Slap him in the face a few times, until he revives
Begin artificial respiration.

questions.question: If you know of a traffic accident resulting in death or injury to a person, you must:

options.text: Do nothing, legally you have no obligation
Stop, notify the police immediately and call 112, the national emergency number
Be informed about the circumstances that caused the accident.

questions.question: Antiseptic substances are used for:

options.text: Disinfecting wounds
Relieving pain
Stopping the bleeding.

questions.question: When an accident victim's heart has stopped beating (cardiac arrest), CPR is performed:

options.text: By pressing rhythmically with the heels of the palms, overlapping the chest (thorax) of the victim, at the level of his heart
By striking the victim's cheek with the palms
By rhythmically crossing the victim’s arms and simultaneously performing artificial respiration.

questions.question: A victim with external bleeding should be placed:

options.text: Such that the bleeding wound is lower than the plane of the body
Any which way, as it does not matter if the wound is located above or below the plane of the body
Such that the bleeding is higher than the body.

questions.question: Stopping the bleeding is done by tying the arm tightly:

options.text: Right at the wound
Above the wound
Below the wound.

questions.question: For a victim with foreign bodies inside a wound, the correct procedure is:

options.text: Extraction of foreign bodies from wounds
Washing foreign bodies with clean water
Foreign bodies should not be removed from wounds, as it can cause complications.

questions.question: In the case of injured persons, who have spine fractures, it is advisable to use:

options.text: Any means of transport, as long as they move in the direction of health units
Any means of transport with a platform, vans or trucks, if the ambulance cannot come to the scene
Cars, because they provide comfort and speed.

questions.question: Respiratory ways can be blocked by:

options.text: Placing the victim on its back
Placing the victim on its side
The entry of foreign bodies in the respiratory tract.

questions.question: Transporting victims to the hospital can be achieved by:

options.text: An ambulance specially equipped for this purpose
An ambulance accompanied by a doctor
The vehicle which caused the accident, if the state of the victim allows it.

questions.question: Signs of a fracture are:

options.text: Pain in the affected area
Pain and unnatural position
Increased temperature and excessive sweating.

questions.question: In case of a victim who is not breathing, the pulse is checked:

options.text: Under the mandible
Near the ear
On the side of the epiglottis (Adam's apple), in the hollow between the trachea and neck muscles.

questions.question: What should be done in case after cardio-respiratory resuscitation, the victim regains pulse?

options.text: Stop external chest compressions
Continue external chest compressions
Apply a bandage on the chest.

questions.question: Cardio-respiratory resuscitation should be performed:

options.text: To any injured person
To the injured who are unconscious, not breathing and have no pulse
Only to the injured who have suffered minor fractures.
